title: How to Use a Bolt Action Rifle

steps.title: Point the gun away from you and anyone in range - the safe direction is almost always at the target(s).
steps.content: Point the gun away from you and anyone in range - the safe direction is almost always at the target(s). If you are setting up the targets yourself, know what lies beyond them. Be sure you know How to Handle a Firearm Safely , and always follow all the rules. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the breech by opening the bolt.
steps.content: Open the breech by opening the bolt. Move the lever or bolt handle upwards, then pull the bolt back as far as you can. (Do not force it, it should come easily) [2] X Research source

steps.title: If there is a round in the breech, remove it.
steps.content: If there is a round in the breech, remove it. Check to see if it has been misfired (it will be indented if so) - if it is a misfire, dispose of it. If you don't know where it came from, dispose of it. Otherwise, fire it at your own risk.

steps.title: If no round, locate a magazine, and place it below the breach, through the stock.
steps.content: If no round, locate a magazine, and place it below the breach, through the stock. You will have to click it into place. Some rifles require manual loading by placing the round behind the breech and SLIDING the round forward into it, until it is secure. Some rifles also have a built in magazine, that requires either a stripper clip or manual loading of each round. These rifles typically take 5-10 rounds. To load bullets manually in these rifles, push bullets down into magazine, they fit with the follower plate. Don't try to fit an extra round in the breech, just fill the magazine to it's capacity. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Push the bolt forward as far as you can, and then close it.
steps.content: Push the bolt forward as far as you can, and then close it. The bolt head strips a bullet from the magazine and the rifle is now ready to fire. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap your dominant hand around the grip, keeping your index finger out side the trigger guard.
steps.content: Wrap your dominant hand around the grip, keeping your index finger out side the trigger guard.

steps.title: Cradle the front of the guard with you other hand (do not touch the barrel)[5] X Research source
steps.content: Cradle the front of the guard with you other hand (do not touch the barrel) [5] X Research source

steps.title: Lock the rifle into your shoulder.
steps.content: Lock the rifle into your shoulder. Hold it firmly.

steps.title: Optional:
steps.content: Optional: If you have a sling, you can gain better control by wrapping it tight with the arm that is cradling the rifle.

steps.title: Remove the safety, by clicking on to 'FIRE' or red button.
steps.content: Remove the safety, by clicking on to 'FIRE' or red button.

steps.title: Place your finger inside the trigger guard.
steps.content: Place your finger inside the trigger guard.

steps.title: Either use the scope and place the crosshairs on the target or line up the two sight posts (one at the front, one at the back of the gun).
steps.content: Either use the scope and place the crosshairs on the target or line up the two sight posts (one at the front, one at the back of the gun). [6] X Research source

steps.title: Take a deep breath and let two-thirds of it out.
steps.content: Take a deep breath and let two-thirds of it out. Hold.

steps.title: SQUEEZE the trigger gently.
steps.content: SQUEEZE the trigger gently. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Exhale, remove finger from trigger guard, safety on.
steps.content: Exhale, remove finger from trigger guard, safety on. Repeat from (4) to fire again.
